name: ip2long
purpose: Converts a string containing an (IPv4) Internet Protocol dotted address into a proper address

return.description:
Returns the IPv4 address or FALSE if ip_address
   is invalid.

notes.description:
Because PHP's integer type is signed, and many IP addresses will
    result in negative integers, you need to use the "%u" formatter of
    sprintf or printf to get
    the string representation of the unsigned IP address.

ip2long will return FALSE for the IP
    255.255.255.255 in PHP 5 <= 5.0.2. It was fixed in
    PHP 5.0.3 where it returns -1 (same as PHP 4).

changelog.change:
Prior to this version, ip2long would sometimes return
        a valid number even if passed an value which was not an (IPv4) Internet Protocol
        dotted address.

Prior to this version, ip2long returned -1 on
        failure.
